members.name: JCOMPONENT_UI
members.comment: Denotes a UI implemented as a Swing component. The value of the string is the fully qualified classname : "javax.swing.JComponent".

members.name: PANEL_UI
members.comment: Denotes a UI implemented as an AWT panel. The value of the string is the fully qualified classname : "java.awt.Panel"

members.name: DIALOG_UI
members.comment: Denotes a UI implemented as an AWT dialog. The value of the string is the fully qualified classname : "java.awt.Dialog"

members.name: JDIALOG_UI
members.comment: Denotes a UI implemented as a Swing dialog. The value of the string is the fully qualified classname : "javax.swing.JDialog"

members.name: ABOUT_UIROLE
members.comment: Denotes a UI which performs an informative "About" role.

members.name: ADMIN_UIROLE
members.comment: Denotes a UI which performs an administrative role.

members.name: MAIN_UIROLE
members.comment: Denotes a UI which performs the normal end user role.

members.name: RESERVED_UIROLE
members.comment: Not a valid role but role id's greater than this may be used for private roles supported by a service. Knowledge of the function performed by this role is required to make proper use of it.

members.name: getUI
members.comment: Get a UI object which may be cast to the requested UI type by the application and used in its user interface.

param: role - requested. Must be one of the standard roles or a private role supported by this factory.
ui - type in which the role is requested
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if the role or ui is neither one of the standard ones, nor a private one supported by the factory
return: the UI role or null if the requested UI role is not available from this factory

members.name: getUIClassNamesForRole
members.comment: Given a UI role obtained from this factory obtain the UI types available from this factory which implement this role. The returned Strings should refer to the static variables defined in this class so that applications can use equality of reference ("==").

throws: IllegalArgumentException - is the role is a non-standard role not supported by this factory
return: the UI types supported by this class for the specified role, null if no UIs are available for the role

name: javax.print.ServiceUIFactory
